question: At which of the following rates, central  government makes Public Distribution System food grains available to states?
explanation: Minimum Support Price (MSP) is the price at which central government procures the foodgrains from farmers.  Central Issue Price (CIP) is the price at which government makes these food grains available to states. CIP of wheat and rice for NFSA beneficiaries has not been revised since the introduction of the Act in 2013 from ` 200 per quintal in case of wheat and ` 300 per quintal in case of rice.
